title: Folders do not return to last email
content:
Hi, since the last update it seems, when I flip between folders, the latest emails are not always shown. I think the best way to show you is with the screen shot. I went back to this folder, and the bar on the right is not at the bottom. Some times it is, sometimes not. I have tried to repair the folders. But no change. It was OK at first but now its irritating.

I think it happens after I have had new mail in a folder. As if it looses its place. I just tested that, and going to the folder and back was fine, new mail came in and it was showing emails from 2021. But not everytime!

Any suggestions please?

Rupert
creator: rupert.bowling

title: unread msg : how to make bold the "sender" only
content:
Hi!

I'm trying to tweak my userChrome.css file. Here is what I'd like to do : - for all unread messages in the thread pane : 

  - show the "sender" in bold and size 12   - show the "object" in normal (not bold) and size 10

Anyone knows how to do it?

Thanks a lot for your help. Olivier

title: Re: Thunderbird launches/opens a new browser window on startup
content: When I open Thunderbird it automatically launches the default browser or opens a new broswer window if the browser is already running. If I leave TB open, it will continue to open browser windows every 15 minutes or so. TB never used to do this but it started quite a while ago and I have never been able to figure it out. It's a mild annoyance.
creator: paul579

title: How to get Thunderbird to list emails on one line per email.
content: I just update Thunderbird to 115.4.1 and now it uses two lines for each email in the list. This significantly reduces the number of emails visible and makes then harder to read as the subjects and correspondents are mixed. Is there a way to restore the one email per line mode?
creator: mhubel

title: Latest upgrade
content:
I hope you didn't intend it, but what on earth have you done in the most recent Thunderbird "update"? Almost every day I delete an email from my inbox by right-clicking and selecting delete from the drop-down. Maybe the chain is complete, quite often it's something suspicious that has slipped by the spam filters and I simply do not want to open it, sometimes it's a delivery company telling me that my parcel has arrived, which I already know. It is always a simple operation and I carry on with my activities. Now however, when I do this, the inbox resets to the very beginning, to the first email that I did not delete, back in 2010 when I first became a user, and I have to scroll through 13 years to get back to today.

Please fix it, quickly. Derek Peters
creator: derek.peters

content: Hello, I'm using Thunderbird (and before Netscape Messenger) already 30 years. With this new version 115.4.1 (32-Bit) I'm now experiencing now so many crashes.

title: Thunderbird 115.4.1 failing to post to usenet then deleting the saved draft
content:
When using Thunderbird 115.4.1 to post a Followup on usenet, e.g. in comp.lang.awk, via my account at eternalseptember.org, roughly 9 times out of 10 after I click the "Send" button Thunderbird will pop up a message box saying "Assembling message" and then just get stuck there. When I eventually get tired of waiting and "x" out of that popup window and save my message in Drafts, I see my message in Drafts and I can click on it to edit it and retry posting it but it will not post. When I close Thunderbird and re-open it the message has, again 9 times out of 10, disappeared from my drafts folder and also still hasn't been posted. When I have this problem I have to manually copy my draft message into a file on my desktop, close Thunderbird, re-open it, then go back to the message I was trying to reply to, click Followup on it again, then paste my saved message into the mail editor window and then hit "Send" and this time it always works.

This is new behavior that I haven't see in previous Thunderbird versions.

Is a fix or better workaround available?
creator: mortonspam

title: emails downloading
content: Downloading of junk emails every day there is over 1000 to 2000 junk emails in the inbox. In all languages.. Can you delete this email? this is very frustrating having to delete junk spam emails every time i open this email... why is it doing this???

title: Thunderbird is automatically moving messages form inbox to trash
content: In the past few weeks I have noticed that when I bring my PC out of the sleep mode by hitting the space bar on the keyboard Thunderbird moves the last message in my inbox to the Trash folder. I didn't realize what was happening until I noticed messages disappearing. And this doesn't seem to happen every time. Rebooting the computer and relaunching Thunderbird does not help. I am using Window 10 with two monitors and Thunderbird 115.4.1. The only other time the space bar does anything is to page down the current message in focus. Any ideas?

creator: john985

title: Best practice for including images in an HTML email footer
content:
BACKGROUND"

Ive setup Thunderbird to use a locally hosted (via dropbbox) HTML file for footers.

This allows me to edit the HTML file once and it will update for any users who are using it. This works fine.

Inside of the footers i have some images (logos etc) these are inserted into the HTML footers using the html tag.

The images themselves eg. the .png files are hosted on a web server. Ive tried to use a relative reference to a local version of the .png file but although this works locally when drafting for some reason when i send the email the image dosnt get sent with.

QUESTIONS"

a) For some users the email footers, with remote images work fine when they are drafting email and when the email is received. For other users the email footer works and the remote image works fine when drafting but when the email is sent the remote image does not load. Any idea why this might be and how i can fix it ?

b) I feel remote hosting the images may be over complicaiting things, instead i would prefer to have a local hosted image sent along with the email, ive tried to do this by referenceing a relative link from the HTML file to the IMG file, this works correctly when drafting the email, but when i send it the image does not get sent along with the email. Any idea why this might be and how i can fix it ?
creator: levene.sam

title: Secure message storage on Mac M1
content: Is it possible to move the location my emails are stored to a encrypted disc image and have Thunderbird use that location? Just wanting to not have my emails stored in plain text on my laptop for additional security. I already have File Vault on but would like additional security for my emails. Open to suggestions of other ways to go about accomplishing the same goal. Looking for a free option if possible. Thank you.
creator: roy60

title: New version display issues
content:
Used Thunderbird for years. No issues. Following upgrade to current version:

1. Usually opens multiple email tabs 2. Most current email is not visible. Drops below bottom line. Must scroll to see it. 3. If you delete the highlighted email, the next email is highlighted so light you can barely see it. 4. Often jumps to othe emails.

Ver 115.4.1

Older version was rock solid. Not sure if these are "features" or problems.
creator: thessick

title: setting up Thunderbird on another laptop
content: Hello, I very recently bought a new laptop and I am trying to set up Thunderbird to access my mail server. It initially came up with "GoDaddy" connections which I have no connection with at all, so I set up the incoming and outgoing manually copying, exactly from my old laptop, but no success. This is really frustrating. Any suggestions?

I have been using Thunderbird for quite some time and over the last few years I have been noticing that the program hangs alot. This happens on ONLY some of my PC's running Thunderbird and I am struggling to understand why as they are all identical, using the same addons, accounts etc.

This happens when we select an email, any email. In some cases, it might hang for 5-15 seconds then load or in other instances, it continues to hang where when we right click the tab in the taskbar and press close, the windows box comes up saying that Thunderbird is not responding.

I have tried using it is safe mode, disabling add-ons, reinstalling it, suring the inbox's are compacted..but nothing

I am sure its something simple, but it really is driving me nuts.

creator: info10246

title: Screen focus not consistent between mailboxes/users.
content: We are running Thunderbird 115 and encountering an annoying issue. We run two separate mailboxes and always sort by date with most recent at the bottom. It seems that whenever we switch from one mailbox to the other, the focus seems to jump to somewhere in the middle of the message library, rather than the 'bottom'/newest message. We scroll to the bottom, and then switch back again to the other mailbox and find our focus again somewhere in the middle...
creator: mnohel

title: Random enabling of 'Threading'
content: We are running Thunderbird 115 and encountering an annoying issue. Somehow 'threading' keeps getting activated randomly. It is not being manually activated since the 'View' setting is not even normally displayed. We have to keep looking for the setting to turn it off as it is a feature that we do not like to use.
creator: mnohel

title: year_display
content: in the inbox the year is not showing as 2023 its showing as 2566. i am using the laptop in asia but i like to see the date as 2023
creator: rony925

title: Message window moves when I delete a message
content: Since the new update, when I delete a message, the message "window" scrolls and I have to scroll back to where I was. This is very annoying and wastes time. I hope my description makes sense.
creator: mkdeupree

title: Mass Emails
content:
As the Secretary of a sporting club I regularly have to send out mass notifications to around 100 members.

I usually have no problems selecting the members, using BCC then composing and sending the message.

On my last batch after I sent the message the programme took forever to show the message in the "sent" folder and when it did none of the text or addresses was visible so i don't know if the messages were received or not. Around 30 were undeliverable and I resent these in smaller batches using the "to" box instead of the BCC and none came back but, again, the messages in the "sent" box were blank. i 'phoned a couple of the addressees and at least two said they had not received the emails.

Is this some new anti-spam measure you have adopted?


Kindest regards, Colin Ballard 6 November 2023
creator: fluffkin21001
